column1: Animal Breeding and Genetics MSc, PgDip
column5: Programme descriptionWe offer a suite of programmes to deliver the knowledge and skills required to:apply quantitative genetic theory to practical problems in both the biomedical and animal science industries.undertake research in a wide range of fields such as evolutionary genetics, animal breeding, human genetics and genome analysisAll our programmes offer the same core content, but you can tailor your degree to reflect your interests.This programme is specifically for those interested in the application of quantitative genetics to animal breeding. If you are interested in other applications you could consider our alternative programmes in:
column7: Tuition fees vary between degree programmes. Find the specific fees for your chosen programme on our website
column9: MSc: 1 year full-time, 2 years part-time; PgDip: 9 months full-time
